sentence.Network_en: He was never dull, always erudite and well informed.
sentence.Network_cn: 他从来就不愚笨，而是一直博学多才、见多识广。

sentence.Network_en: Through hard work, he finally made himself into an erudite man.
sentence.Network_cn: 他经过不断地刻苦学习终于成为通人.

sentence.Network_en: Erudite Park ( type ): Cultural and Creative Park campus.
sentence.Network_cn: 博学园 ( 类型 ): 校园文化创意园.

erudite Park ( type ) : cultural and Creative Park campus .博学园（类型)：校园文化创意园。
I hadn't realized that there could be so much erudition about a matter like this .我没想到这样一件事竟有这么大的学问。
an erudite professor ;, 博学的教授.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin eruditus, past participle of erudire 'instruct, train' (based on rudis 'rude, untrained')

entry.tran: 博学的;有学问的；（书等）知识丰富的
entry.def: If you describe someone as erudite, you mean that they have or show great academic knowledge. You can also use erudite to describe something such as a book or a style of writing.

example.ex: He was never dull, always erudite and well informed.
example.tran: 他从来就不愚笨，而是一直博学多才、见多识广。
有独创性且非常博学的风格

auth_sentence.content: The book is engaging, erudite, and blinkered.
auth_sentence.res_content: The book is engaging, erudite, and blinkered.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The book is engaging, erudite, and blinkered.

auth_sentence.content: They are one erudite and merciless bunch over there.
auth_sentence.res_content: They are one erudite and merciless bunch over there.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They are one erudite and merciless bunch over there.

auth_sentence.content: But the gardening-mad Duchess slyly understood all her correspondent's erudite gags.
auth_sentence.res_content: But the gardening-mad Duchess slyly understood all her correspondent's erudite gags.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But the gardening-mad Duchess slyly understood all her correspondent's erudite gags.

stems_affixes.word_buile: e出+rud原始,粗野+ite……的→走出原始状态的→博学的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 粗鲁的;猛烈的,残暴的;粗糙的,粗陋的
stems_affixes.word_buile: rud原始,粗野+e→adj.粗鲁的;猛烈的,残暴的;粗糙的,粗陋的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 基本的, 入门的, 初步的
stems_affixes.word_buile: rudiment[n.初步]+al……的→adj.基本的, 入门的, 初步的
erudite[adj.博学的,饱学的]+ion表名词→n.博学
rudi=rud原始,粗野+ment物→原始的东西→初步
rudi=rud原始,粗野+ment物+s复数→原始的东西,基本知识

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表动词,"促成"; 2. 表形容词,"有……的"; 3. 表名词,"人或物"

stems_affixes.value_cn: 明确的;一定的;意志坚强的,立场坚定的
stems_affixes.word_buile: de强调+fin界线+ite有……的→adj.明确的;一定的;意志坚强的,立场坚定的
e出+rud原始+ite有……的→走出原始状态→博学

stems_affixes.value_cn: 优美的,高雅的,精致的;剧烈的,异常的
stems_affixes.word_buile: ex出+quis寻求+ite有……的→adj.优美的,高雅的,精致的;剧烈的,异常的
favor好感,宠爱+ite有……的→adj.喜爱的,宠爱的
favorite[adj.喜爱的,宠爱的]→adj.喜爱的,宠爱的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 有礼貌的,客气的;有教养的,文雅的
stems_affixes.word_buile: pol擦亮,文雅+ite有……的→adj.有礼貌的,客气的;有教养的,文雅的
anchor隐藏+ite人或物→n.隐士
bedlam混乱,骚乱+ite人或物→n.疯子,狂人

stems_affixes.value_cn: [集合名词]精华;精锐;中坚分子;精英
stems_affixes.word_buile: el=elect选举+ite人→选出的人→精英
favor喜爱+ite人或物→n.[favourite]最喜欢的人或物 adj.喜爱的
favorite[n.[favourite]最喜欢的人或物 adj.喜爱的]→n.特别喜欢的人[或物]
gran颗粒+ite人或物→n.花岗岩,花岗石
social社会的+ite人或物→n.社会名流,名士
term+ite人或物→来自拉丁文termes白蚁
ex出+ped脚+ite促成→把脚跨出去→加快
ign火+ite促成→v.点火,引燃
